intro: Ornithogalum gifbergense, commonly known as the Gifberg star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, white or pale blue flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
